Natural Mathematics is an international, peer-reviewed open-access journal dedicated to exploring the profound connections between mathematics and the natural world. The journal provides a platform for original research, reviews, and methodological advances that highlight how mathematical theory, modeling, and computation contribute to understanding natural phenomena.

The scope of Natural Mathematics includes, but is not limited to:

  • Mathematical biology and ecology
  • Dynamical systems in physics and chemistry
  • Biostatistics and epidemiological modeling
  • Mathematical approaches to earth and environmental sciences
  • Computational and data-driven methods for natural processes
  • Applied mathematics for sustainability and climate change

By fostering interdisciplinary dialogue, the journal seeks to bridge the gap between abstract mathematics and real-world applications, promoting discoveries that advance both theoretical insight and practical solutions.

Published quarterly, Natural Mathematics welcomes contributions from mathematicians, scientists, and practitioners worldwide who are committed to expanding the role of mathematics in interpreting and solving natural challenges.

Natural Mathematics is an international, peer-reviewed journal exploring the interplay between mathematics and the natural world. It publishes original research, reviews, and methodological advances in areas such as mathematical biology, ecology, physics, and environmental sciences. The journal emphasizes the use of mathematical models, computation, and data-driven methods to explain natural phenomena. By fostering interdisciplinary dialogue, it bridges abstract mathematics with real-world applications. Natural Mathematics is published quarterly and welcomes contributions from researchers worldwide.

Mission

The mission of Natural Mathematics is to advance understanding of the natural world through the power of mathematics. The journal strives to provide a platform where theoretical innovation meets practical application, fostering research that bridges pure mathematics with real-world scientific challenges. By encouraging interdisciplinary collaboration, it seeks to inspire solutions that contribute to scientific progress and societal well-being.

Scope

Natural Mathematics welcomes high-quality contributions in areas where mathematics illuminates natural processes, including but not limited to:

  • Mathematical biology, ecology, and epidemiology
  • Dynamical systems in physics, chemistry, and earth sciences
  • Computational models and data-driven approaches
  • Climate change, sustainability, and environmental modeling
  • Applied statistics and quantitative methodologies in natural sciences

The journal is committed to publishing work that demonstrates both mathematical rigor and relevance to pressing natural and scientific questions.

Editorial Policies

Peer Review

All manuscripts submitted to Natural Mathematics undergo a rigorous peer-review process. Submissions are first evaluated by the editorial team for scope, originality, and quality. Suitable manuscripts are then reviewed by at least two independent experts to ensure scientific validity, clarity, and relevance.

Open Access

The journal is committed to open access, ensuring that published research is freely available to the global community without subscription or access barriers.

Ethical Standards

Authors must adhere to the highest standards of academic integrity. Plagiarism, data fabrication, and duplicate submissions are strictly prohibited. The journal follows internationally recognized ethical guidelines, including COPE (Committee on Publication Ethics) principles.

Authorship & Contributions

All listed authors must have made a significant contribution to the research and approved the final version of the manuscript. Any conflicts of interest must be disclosed at submission.

Data & Transparency

Authors are encouraged to share data, models, and code to support reproducibility and transparency. Supplementary materials may be published alongside articles when appropriate.

Corrections & Retractions

In cases of major errors or ethical breaches, the journal reserves the right to issue corrections, expressions of concern, or retractions in line with best publishing practices.

Information for Authors

Manuscript Submission

Authors are invited to submit original research articles, reviews, or methodological papers relevant to the journal’s scope. Submissions must be made electronically through the online submission system.

Formatting Guidelines

Manuscripts should be written in clear English.
Use standard structure: Title, Abstract, Keywords, Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, References.
Figures and tables must be high quality and properly labeled.
References should follow a consistent citation style (APA, IEEE, or as specified in the submission portal).

Open Access Policy

All articles are published under open access, ensuring free and permanent availability to the global research community.

Ethical Requirements

Authors must ensure originality of their work, cite relevant sources, and avoid plagiarism. Studies involving human or animal subjects must include ethical approval statements.

Review Process

Each manuscript will undergo an initial editorial screening followed by double-blind peer review. Decisions (accept, revise, reject) will be communicated promptly.

Article Charges

As an open-access journal, publication may involve article processing charges (APCs). Waivers or discounts may be available for authors from low- and middle-income countries.

Copyright & Licensing

Authors retain copyright under a Creative Commons license, allowing wide dissemination and reuse with proper attribution.

Contact

For inquiries regarding submission, formatting, or policies, authors may contact the editorial office at: editor@naturalmathjournal.org

Information for Reviewers

Role of Reviewers

Reviewers play a critical role in maintaining the quality, integrity, and credibility of Natural Mathematics. Their evaluations ensure that published manuscripts meet the highest standards of originality, clarity, and scientific rigor.

Review Process

Reviews are conducted under a double-blind policy: both authors and reviewers remain anonymous. Reviewers are expected to provide constructive, objective, and timely feedback. The typical review period is 2–4 weeks from the date of invitation.

Evaluation Criteria

Reviewers should assess:

  • Relevance of the manuscript to the journal’s scope.
  • Originality and significance of the contribution.
  • Soundness of methodology and analysis.
  • Clarity of presentation and structure.
  • Proper referencing of prior work.
  • Ethical Responsibilities
  • Maintain confidentiality of all submitted material.
  • Declare any conflicts of interest before accepting a review.
  • Avoid using or sharing unpublished data for personal advantage.

Recognition

Reviewers’ contributions are acknowledged through annual certificates of service, and exceptional reviewers may be highlighted by the editorial board.

Support

Guidelines and reviewer resources are available on the journal’s website. For questions, contact: review@naturalmathjournal.org
